contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Strzelce Opolskie | image_skyline = Kościół św. Wawrzyńca w Strzelcach Opolskich1.JPG | image_caption = Saint Lawrence Church | image_flag = POL Strzelce Opolskie flag.svg | image_shield = POL Strzelce Opolskie COA.svg | pushpin_map = Poland | pushpin_label_position = bottom | coordinates_region = PL | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{POL}} | subdivision_type1 = [[Voivodeships of Poland|Voivodeship]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Opole Voivodeship|Opole]] | subdivision_type2 = [[Powiat|County]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Strzelce County|Strzelce]] | subdivision_type3 = [[Gmina]] | subdivision_name3 = [[Gmina Strzelce Opolskie|Strzelce Opolskie]] | leader_title = Mayor | leader_name = Tadeusz Goc | area_total_km2 = 30.13 | population_as_of = 2006 | population_total = 20059 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone = [[Central European Time|CET]] | utc_offset = +1 | timezone_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] | utc_offset_DST = +2 | latd = 50 | latm = 30 | lats = | latNS = N | longd = 18 | longm = 17 | longs = | longEW = E | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = 47-100 | blank_name = [[Polish car number plates|Car plates]] | blank_info = OST | website = http://www.strzelceopolskie.pl }} '''Strzelce Opolskie''' {{IPAc-pl|'|s|t|sz|e|l|c|e|-|o|'|p|o|l|s|k|J|e}} ({{lang-de|Groß Strehlitz}}) is a town in south-western [[Poland]] with 19,628 inhabitants (2006), situated in the [[Opole Voivodeship]]. It is the capital of [[Strzelce County]]. Strzelce Opolskie is one of the biggest centers of German minority in Poland. The town is located along the major rail line which joins [[Gliwice]] and [[Opole]]. Until 1999, there was a branch line connecting Strzelce Opolskie with [[Kędzierzyn Koźle]]. It closed as part of PKP's cost-cutting measures, although the rails still (2006) remain in situ. ==Notable residents== * [[Hermann Bix]] (1914–1986), officer * [[Johannes Bunzek]] (1922–1943), Luftwaffe pilot * [[Helmuth Förster]] (1889–1965), general * [[Heinz Kokott]] (1900–1976), general * [[Erich Mende]] (1916–1998), politician ==International relations== {{See also|List of twin towns and sister cities in Poland}} ===Twin towns — sister cities=== Strzelce Opolskie is [[town twinning|twinned]] with: * {{flagicon|GER}} [[Soest, Germany|Soest]], [[Germany]] ==External links== * [http://www.sztetl.org.pl/en/city/strzelce-opolskie/ Jewish Community in Strzelce Opolskie] on Virtual Shtetl {{commons category|Strzelce Opolskie}} {{coord|50|31|N|18|18|E|region:PL_type:city|display=title}} <br> {{Strzelce County}} {{Gmina Strzelce Opolskie}} [[Category:Cities and towns in Opole Voivodeship]] [[Category:Strzelce County]] [[Category:Cities in Silesia]] {{Opole-geo-stub}}
